result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan K Reece was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bryan K Reece in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to Possession of Cocaine/Coca, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.41(3g)(c), a class U Misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Court sentenced defendant to serve FOUR (4) DAYS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for FOUR (4) days served; TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 04-18-2017 or a civil judgment to be entered WITH tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Defendant Bryan K Reece in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant has made THREE OF THREE (3/3) scheduled meetings.  Defendant has tested negative CONSISTENTLY.  Defense advised that Defendant was recently involved in an automobile accident and HAS completed EIGHT (8) HOURS out of FORTY (40) HOURS in Community Service.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bryan K Reece in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant is in Compliance.  State would like to set an interim Review date.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bryan K Reece in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for final review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bryan K Reece in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Filed, Justice Point Report dated 9/22/2015.

Defendant Bryan K Reece in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea and sentencing, however defense requests time to look into a DPA.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
This assignment is only effective as of 8/3/2015.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Witkowiak, Br. 22.  aw

Defendant Bryan K Reece in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Defense wants to refer the defendant to drug treatment court.  Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Building.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Case assigned to Judge Witkowiak.  Clerk contacted Judge Watts court for the next court date.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 8/12/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 22.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bryan K Reece in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has received discovery, and a new offer.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 6/23/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Bryan K Reece in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Ronald Dague for Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/27/15.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Bryan K Reece in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Bryan K Reece in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
